DataElement.preferredName: Cervical Tumor Pathologic M v7 Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to pathologic M stage of a cervical tumor (or cancer of the uterine cervix)._A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to pathologic M stage of a cervical tumor (or cancer of the uterine cervix).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Relating to a neck, or cervix, in any sense.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7 Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0 for cervical cancer. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0 for cervical cancer. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer with distant metastasis (including peritoneal spread, involvement of supraclavicular, mediastinal, or paraaortic lymph nodes, lung, liver, or bone). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer with distant metastasis (including peritoneal spread, involvement of supraclavicular, mediastinal, or paraaortic lymph nodes, lung, liver, or bone). (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cervical Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cervical Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cervical cancer in which there is no evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer cM0 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Cervical cancer in which there is no evidence of distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7 Stage
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0 for cervical cancer. (from AJCC 7th Ed.):The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Cervical Cancer Pathologic Distant Metastasis TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cervical cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0 for cervical cancer. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
The extent of a cancer in the body.
